page.title: 09NEW BLACKSMITH IN CLAYPOLE
page.content: The blacksmith business was started in a garage in Newark thirty three years ago by my grandad and carried on by my uncle, Maurice Leach, eight years ago. From Newark it moved to Claypole because the business expanded and we needed more room for machinery. The three blacksmiths make items such as spiral staircases, gates, grain hoppers and, more recently, nuclear fall-out shelters. My uncle deals with all types of people, from the gardener who wants his spade mending to the man who decides there is a nuclear war coming soon. He has a lot of modern machinery including welders, steel guillotines, electric grinders as well as the traditional anvil and hammer.
